Implementation Notes

Integration Approaches:

  • Direct API: Communicate with Open WebUI's REST API endpoints for chat completions
  • WebSocket: Use WebSocket connection for streaming responses
  • Proxy: Set up a proxy endpoint on this server to handle Ollama/Open WebUI requests
  • Python Backend: Create a Python service using ollama-python library for more control

Current Implementation: UI mockup - backend integration pending. Configuration and prompts are stored locally for future implementation.

Account Management

Manage your financial accounts, upload screenshots, and track balances securely

Your Accounts

Merge Mode Active

No accounts added yet

Upload Account Screenshot

Upload a screenshot of your account dashboard to automatically update balances

How it works:
  • Upload a clear screenshot showing account names and balances
  • The system will extract account information using OCR
  • Existing accounts will be updated with new balances
  • New accounts found in the screenshot will be created automatically
  • Screenshots are deleted immediately after processing for security
Supported formats: JPG, PNG, WebP. Max size: 10MB
The date these account balances represent. Defaults to today. Cannot select future dates.

Monte Carlo Simulation Parameters

These settings control the retirement planning simulation accuracy and assumptions

More simulations = more accurate results (default: 10,000)
Planning horizon for retirement (default: 30 years)

APIs and Connections

Configure API keys and connection settings used by multiple widgets. Managing credentials here reduces duplication and simplifies maintenance.

OpenWeatherMap API

This API is used by the Weather Widget, Forecast Widget, Vacation Widget, and Smart Widget (Rain Forecast). Get a free API key at openweathermap.org/api.

This key will be used by all weather-related widgets (Weather, Forecast, Vacation, Rain Forecast)
Default location for weather widgets (can be overridden per widget)
Default units for all weather widgets
Note:

Widget-specific settings (location, display options, refresh intervals) are configured in each widget's section below. Only the API credentials are centralized here for easier management.

AviationStack Flight API

This API is used for flight tracking in the Vacation Widget. It provides real-time flight status, delays, gate information, and more. Get a free API key at aviationstack.com (Free tier: 100 API calls/month).

Required for automatic flight tracking and validation
Enable to use real-time flight tracking
Free tier: 100 calls/month (adjust if you have a paid plan)

Troubleshooting: If validation fails, compare this fingerprint with the key you tested. They should match.
Rate Limiting & Update Schedule

To respect the free tier's 100 calls/month limit, flight data is automatically updated on this schedule:

  • Default: Once per day at 7am for all tracked flights
  • 3 days before flight: 3x daily (7am, noon, 5pm)
  • Final 6 hours: Hourly updates for real-time tracking

Flight data is cached between updates to minimize API calls. You can manually trigger an update from the tracked flights list below.

Vacation Widget (Upcoming Vacations)

Configure vacation dates and destinations in the House Vacation Dates section above. The widget will automatically display upcoming vacations with weather, timezone, and countdown information.

API Key: Configure your OpenWeatherMap API key in the APIs and Connections section above. The same key is used for vacation destination weather.
Air Quality Widget (Compact AQI Display)
When enabled, the widget will glow green when air quality is "Good" (AQI=1) and temperature is 75F or less, indicating favorable outdoor conditions.

The Air Quality Widget displays current AQI (Air Quality Index) and forecasts for today and tomorrow. It uses the OpenWeatherMap Air Pollution API to provide real-time air quality data including PM2.5, PM10, and other pollutants.

AQI Scale:
1 = Good () | 2 = Fair () | 3 = Moderate () | 4 = Poor () | 5 = Very Poor ()

API Key: Configure your OpenWeatherMap API key in the APIs and Connections section above. The same key is used for weather and air quality data.

Backup & Restore

Export all your site configurations and data to a backup file, or restore from a previously exported backup.

Export Data
Security Note:

For security, sensitive credentials (API keys, tokens, passwords) are NOT included in exports. You will need to re-enter these after importing.

The export will include:

  • Magic Mirror configuration (widget settings, layout)
  • Server settings and preferences
  • Vidiots configuration (excluding GitHub token)
  • Espresso configuration and data
  • Finance data (accounts, demographics, settings)
  • Useful links
  • Connected devices
  • Drink mixer recipes and ingredients
  • Tournament data
  • Client configurations
Import Data
Warning:

Importing a backup will overwrite existing configurations. Existing API keys and passwords will be preserved if they are not included in the import file.

Select a .json backup file previously exported from this system

Account to Unmerge:

Important:
